description: "CBS Evening News" anchor and managing editor Norah O'Donnell was given a private tour of the magnificent St. Peter's Basilica, the largest church in the world, located in the smallest nation in the world.
title: A tour of St. Peter's Basilica in Vatican City

description: Pope Francis called for countries at war to negotiate in an exclusive interview with "CBS Evening News" anchor and managing editor Norah O'Donnell in Rome. "A negotiated peace is better than a war without end," the pontiff said. "Look to negotiate. Look for peace."
title: Pope Francis says "negotiated peace is better than a war without end"

description: The Supreme Court on Wednesday listened to arguments over whether Idaho's near-total abortion ban violates a federal law that requires hospitals that participate in Medicare to provide necessary stabilizing treatment, including emergency abortion care. Jan Crawford reports.
title: Supreme Court hears arguments on Idaho abortion ban

description: CBS News asked Catholics in cities across the U.S. about their relationship with the church and how they feel about the pope. Nikki Battiste has more.
title: U.S. Catholics and their relationship to the church

description: Here's a look at the top stories making headlines on the "CBS Evening News with Norah O'Donnell."
title: "CBS Evening News" headlines for Wednesday, April 24, 2024

description: Paul Grice, 31, was arrested and charged by Oklahoma authorities with murder and kidnapping in connection to the deaths of Veronica Butler and Jilian Kelley.
title: 5th person charged in killing of 2 Kansas moms, officials say

description: In an exclusive interview with CBS News' Norah O'Donnell, Pope Francis called for "negotiated peace" in Ukraine and Gaza, noting the devastating effects war has on children.
title: Pope Francis says "a negotiated peace is better than a war without end"

description: President Biden signed into law a foreign aid bill that also includes a provision that could ban TikTok. ByteDance, the Chinese company that owns the popular social media platform, will have to sell it within a certain period of time in order to avoid the ban. CBS News congressional correspondent Nikole Killion reports.
title: Potential TikTok ban signed into law

description: These best cooling floor fans from Dyson, Honeywell, Black+Decker and more will cool you in the months ahead.
title: The best floor fans of 2024 will keep you cool in the hot days to come

description: The Supreme Court is reviewing a near-total Idaho abortion law that could dictate the type of care pregnant mothers can receive in emergency rooms. CBS News chief legal correspondent Jan Crawford breaks down the hearing.
title: Emotions run high during Idaho abortion access Supreme Court hearing

description: The Supreme Court is set to hear arguments on President Donald Trump's claim that he should be immune from federal prosecution for his conduct while serving in the White House. CBS News' Errol Barnett breaks down the history of presidential power limits.
title: Supreme Court to consider Trump's presidential immunity claim

description: New Jersey Rep. Donald Payne Jr. has died at the age of 65. The Democrat was first elected in 2012 to represent the state's 10th Congressional District, which includes the city of Newark. Errol Barnett has more.
title: New Jersey Rep. Donald Payne Jr. dies at age 65

description: Pro-Palestinian protesters at the University of Southern California were forced to clear their tents by campus police Wednesday. CBS News Los Angeles reporter Luzdelia Caballero is following the protests.
title: Pro-Palestinian protests erupt at University of Southern California

description: The rat hole had been there for several years—some estimate around 20—but gained fame on social media just this year.
title: Chicago "rat hole" removed from sidewalk, but preserved intact

description: Representatives from across the world are gathering in Ottawa, Canada, to negotiate a potential treaty to limit plastic pollution. CBS News national environmental correspondent David Schechter has the latest on the talks.
title: Global delegates negotiate plastic pollution treaty

description: Two-year-old Tyler Fabregas asked his mother "Where's Beyoncé​?" in a viral TikTok video​ she posted last week from Manila.
title: Beyoncé sends 2-year-old Philippines boy flowers after viral video

description: Proponents say a sweeping ban on noncompete clauses should boost workers, but the new rules face serious legal challenges.
title: 5 things to know about the new federal ban on noncompete agreements

description: Arizona's House of Representatives on Wednesday advanced an effort to repeal the state's Civil War-era abortion ban that's set to go into effect June 8. CBS News campaign reporter Shawna Mizelle has the latest from Phoenix.
title: Arizona House advances effort to repeal 1864 near-total abortion ban

description: Four-year-old Abigail Mor Edan was held by Hamas for 50 days and was the youngest American hostage released by Hamas.
title: Biden meets 4-year-old who was held hostage by Hamas

description: Egg prices are jumping as an outbreak of highly pathogenic avian influenza forces producers to slaughter millions of infected birds.
title: Bird flu outbreak is driving up egg prices — again

description: If you're thinking about getting a home equity loan, you may want to do so before May. Here's why.
title: Why you should get a home equity loan before May

description: The best meal kits for weight loss make it easy (and fun!) to stick to a healthy, consistent diet.
title: The best meal kits for weight loss and fitness-friendly eating

description: Campus Department of Public Safety officers visited the encampment, instructed students not to hang signs, flags or other materials from trees and posts in the park, and warned them not to use megaphones.
title: Pro-Palestinian protesters at USC's Alumni Park are forced to clear tents by campus police

description: I sampled America's most popular meal kit to see how it stacks up in terms of price, accessibility, and more.
title: We reviewed HelloFresh, and you should definitely subscribe, especially if you love cheesecake

description: Gift your grad the gear they'll love to help prepare them for a fruitful life and career once they leave dorm life behind.

description: New Transportation Department rules could save consumers $500 million annually, Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg said.
title: What airline passengers should know about their rights to get refunds

description: Don't brush your teeth after breakfast? Or after vomiting? Dentists say it can wear away your enamel. Here's what to do instead.
title: 3 times you shouldn't brush your teeth, according to dental experts

description: Gustav Klimt's "Portrait of Fräulein Lieser," which went missing after its owners fled Austria after 1930, was auctioned off for $32 million.
title: Klimt portrait lost for nearly 100 years auctioned for $32 million

description: Federal officials say they're double checking whether pasteurization has eradicated the danger from possible bird virus particles in milk.
title: U.S. orders cow testing for bird flu after grocery milk tests positive

description: If you aren't interested in picking up the newest iPhone model, these phones are all great in their own right.

description: Ann Mayers entered AurGroup Credit Union on April 19 and "demanded money while displaying a handgun," police said.
title: Woman, 74, who allegedly robbed bank may have been scam victim, family says

description: Columbia University is giving pro-Palestinian protesters on campus an extension to clear out the premises while House Speaker Mike Johnson is set to visit the campus Wednesday to meet with Jewish students. This comes as schools across the nation join the effort to protest Israel's action against civilians in Gaza. CBS News' Nancy Chen reports from New York City, and CBS News Bay Area's Shawn Chitnis reports from the University of California, Berkeley.
title: Speaker Johnson to visit Columbia University as campus protest continues

description: House Speaker Mike Johnson is visiting Columbia University on Wednesday where he's expected to join calls for the president's resignation and decry "virulent antisemitism" on campuses.
title: House speaker to visit Columbia University, call for president's resignation

description: There are benefits to considering a fixed-rate HELOC in today's economic climate, but there are downsides, too.
title: Does a fixed-rate HELOC make sense in today's elevated rate environment?

description: This 2024 "State of the Air" report warns efforts to reduce emissions are undermined by extreme heat, drought and wildfires caused by climate change.
title: Worst U.S. cities for air pollution ranked by lung association

description: Niselio Barros Garcia Jr., 50, scammed victims out of $2.3 million in funds, according to authorities.
title: Florida man gets 4 years in prison for laundering romance scam proceeds

description: Trump Media CEO Devin Nunes is asking four House committees to investigate possible "naked" short selling in the company's shares.
title: Trump Media asks lawmakers to investigate "unlawful trading activity"

description: Viktoria Nasyrova is accused of using cheesecake as a murder weapon. Her motive was to steal the identity of Olga, who looks a lot like her. "48 Hours" correspondent Peter Van Sant reports, Saturday, April 27 at 9/8c on CBS and streaming on Paramount+.
title: Sneak peek: The Case of the Poison Cheesecake

description: President Biden spoke from the White House Wednesday after signing into law a $95 billion foreign aid package that will send money to Israel, Ukraine and Taiwan. The president had been pushing Congress on the legislation for months. CBS News chief White House correspondent Nancy Cordes had analysis of Mr. Biden's remarks following his address.
title: Biden speaks after signing $95 billion foreign aid package into law

description: A debt relief service may be able to help you deal with mounting debt. Here's why now is a great time to sign up.
title: Why now is a great time to consider debt relief

description: The New Jersey Democrat suffered "a cardiac episode based on complications from his diabetes" earlier this month.
title: New Jersey Rep. Donald Payne Jr. dies

description: There are a few reasons why you may want to put some money in gold before the Fed meets again. Here's what to know.
title: Should you invest in gold before the Fed's April meeting?

description: Lisa Ling is a CBS News contributor and part of the sandwich generation herself. Ling's family is part of nearly 80 million Americans taking care of children and our elderly parents at the same time.
title: The hidden struggles of the sandwich generation

description: Testimony in Donald Trump's New York criminal trial will resume Thursday. Former National Enquirer publisher David Pecker returned to the stand Tuesday and detailed a coordinated plan to suppress negative stories about Trump in the lead-up to the 2016 election. CBS News legal contributor Jessica Levinson has analysis on Pecker's testimony and other updates in the case.
title: Former publisher describes effort to kill Trump stories in "hush money" trial

description: Condé Nast Traveler's annual Hot List is here. Executive editor Erin Florio joined CBS News for an exclusive first look at the diverse range of hotels, restaurants and cruises that made the cut.
title: Exclusive first look at Condé Nast Traveler's 2024 Hot List

description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken is in China this week for critical talks. The Middle East, the war in Ukraine, Taiwan, human rights issues and TikTok are all expected to be on the agenda. CBS News contributor Isaac Stone Fish has a look at where the U.S.-China relationship stands right now.
title: Blinken arrives in China for talks over Russia, Taiwan, Middle East and more

description: Mortgage points can help homebuyers significantly reduce their monthly mortgage payments. Here's how.
title: How much can you save by buying mortgage points?

description: Family members of the victims of two deadly Boeing 737 Max crashes in 2018 and 2019 are meeting with the Justice Department Wednesday as officials continue their investigation into the Alaska Airlines mid-air door blowout that occurred earlier this year. Investigators are looking into whether Boeing went against the terms of an agreement that was reached after those crashes. CBS News Homeland Security and Justice reporter Nicole Sganga has more.
title: Justice Department meets with family members of Boeing 737 Max crash victims

description: For the first time, surgeons at NYU Langone Health performed a combined mechanical heart pump and gene-edited pig kidney transplant into a living person.
title: Doctors perform first combined heart pump and pig kidney transplant

description: From kid-sized carry-ons to super-sized family luggage, invest in these suitcases for your next family vacation.
title: Best luggage for families in 2024

description: The deadline for Columbia University students to clear a protest encampment has been extended for 48 hours. The university said it's making "important progress" in talks with the pro-Palestinian protesters. CBS News New York reporter Elijah Westbrook is following the story.
title: Columbia University extends deadline to clear protest encampment

description: Though long-term care insurance may be available in your 80s, you shouldn't wait to apply. Here's why.
title: Why you should apply for long-term care insurance before your 80s

description: Are you a senior considering your life insurance options now? Here are three smart approaches to consider.
title: 3 smart life insurance moves seniors should make right now

description: The former star USC running back's name is back on the Heisman Winners Archive list​, and Bush will be part of all future Heisman Trophy ceremonies, starting with the 90th Heisman Trophy ceremony this fall.
title: Reggie Bush gets his 2005 Heisman Trophy back

description: "It's a good day for America, it's a good day for Europe and it's a good day for world peace," Mr. Biden said in remarks from the White House.
title: Biden signs foreign aid bill, clearing the way for new weapons for Ukraine

description: A video released by Hamas' military wing appears to show U.S.-Israeli hostage Hersh Goldberg-Polin delivering a message under duress.
title: Hamas releases video of Israeli-American hostage Hersh Goldberg-Polin

description: The British Parliament passed a law that allows authorities to put any asylum-seekers arriving in the U.K. without prior permission on a plane and send them to Rwanda. The law is intended to act as a deterrent to anyone trying to enter the U.K. illegally. CBS News foreign correspondent Ramy Inocencio breaks down what you need to know about the controversial program.
title: U.K. passes law to send asylum-seekers to Rwanda

description: Two years after overturning Roe v. Wade, the Supreme Court is hearing a high-profile abortion case Wednesday involving Idaho's near-total abortion ban. The Biden administration is challenging the Idaho law with a creative legal argument, saying it conflicts with an existing federal law requiring hospitals to provide emergency care for pregnant women, even if it means performing an abortion to save the mother's life. CBS News chief legal correspondent Jan Crawford is at the Supreme Court with more.
title: Supreme Court hearing Idaho abortion access case

description: Rapper Toomaj Salehi has been jailed for more than a year and a half for his support of protests after Mahsa Amini's death, according to local media.
title: Iran reportedly sentences dissident rapper to death for backing protests

description: Between now and 2030, about 10,000 people in the U.S. will turn 65 every single day. Many experts say the country is unprepared to care for them, and that care often falls on their adult children. As Americans have children later in life, many end up taking care of a parent and young kids at the same time. They're referred to as the "sandwich generation." CBS News contributor Lisa Ling understands it personally, and she's diving into this issue.
title: The mounting pressures on those caring for both aging parents and young children

description: Deesha Dyer, a former hip-hop journalist and community college student from Philadelphia, shares her inspiring path to becoming the White House social secretary under former President Barack Obama. Her new book, "Undiplomatic: How My Attitude Created the Best Kind of Trouble," details her rise from a 2009 internship to managing state dinners concerts, and high-profile visits, including from the pope.
title: Deesha Dyer talks going from hip-hop journalist to White House social secretary in new book

description: Two military horses, including one seemingly covered in blood, went on the loose through the streets of central London and injured at least four people.
title: 2 military horses seen running loose in central London

description: Reverse mortgages can often be smart financial tools in retirement, according to the experts we spoke with.
title: Here's when a reverse mortgage makes sense, experts say

description: The judge in Donald Trump's "hush money" case is still weighing whether the former president violated his gag order with his social media posts. There was a hearing Tuesday that saw fireworks between Trump's legal team and the judge, but there wasn't an immediate ruling. Attorney and CBS News campaign reporter Katrina Kaufman breaks down the latest in the case.
title: Judge says Trump's attorney is losing credibility during gag order hearing

description: Throughout hours of testimony in Donald Trump’s New York criminal trial, David Pecker, former National Enquirer publisher, described a strategy ahead of the 2016 presidential election to buy stories and kill them to protect the former president.
title: David Pecker, former National Enquirer publisher, testifies in Trump’s New York criminal trial

description: Next time you have trouble with your flight, you could be entitled to a cash refund. New rules from the U.S. Department of Transportation cover canceled flights and delays meeting certain requirements if you choose not to fly, along with specific fees.
title: New airline rules could save passengers money

description: TikTok has up to a year to be sold by its China-based owner for face a ban in the U.S., potentially impacting 170 million users and small businesses nationwide. The bill won bipartisan support on fears China could use TikTok to collect and exploit Americans’ private data.
title: TikTok has up to a year to be sold or could face a potential ban

description: The Federal Trade Commission is planning to ban non-compete clauses, which are the parts of employer contracts that bar workers from leaving for a competitor or starting a competing business. The measure is not official and the U.S. Chamber of Commerce called the ban “unlawful,” saying it would sue the FTC to block it.
title: FTC looks to ban non-compete clauses, impacting millions of workers

description: Nationwide, students are demonstrating to express their anger over the war in Gaza. At Columbia University, the school warned students they have 48 hours to remove an encampment from campus. At NYU, plywood barricades were erected Tuesday around a campus plaza after 120 people were arrested at a demonstration Monday.
title: Tensions rising on college campuses as students express anger over war in Gaza

description: "America is a nation founded on the promise of second chances," President Biden said in a statement.
title: Biden grants clemency to 16 nonviolent drug offenders

description: Richard Ehrhart was hiking the Natural Bridges coastal trail when he fell, authorities said.
title: Man falls to his death while hiking with wife along Oregon coast

description: The elevated APYs offered on certain online savings accounts right now can help you fight inflation.
title: 3 great reasons to open an online savings account this month

description: Ukraine claims to have destroyed almost 1 million cubic feet of fuel in a drone strike on Russian state-owned oil depots.
title: Huge fire seen as Ukraine hits Russian oil depots with drone strike

description: Country music star Blake Shelton expands his popular bar and music venue 'Ole Red' from Nashville to Las Vegas. This opening coincides with Shelton stepping back from his prominent TV roles.
title: Blake Shelton talks new venue in Las Vegas, life with Gwen Stefani

description: Authorities are offering a $20,000 reward for information that aids their investigation into a dolphin found shot dead in Louisiana.

description: More demonstrations over Israel's war in Gaza and what protesters at Columbia say they want amid allegations of antisemitism. Also, tough testimony for former President Donald Trump from his longtime friend David Pecker, the former publisher of the National Enquirer. All that and all that matters in today’s Eye Opener.
title: Eye Opener: Demonstrations on college campuses continue in response to the war in Israel

description: Glenn Sullivan Sr., 54, pleaded guilty to four counts of second-degree rape on April 17.

description: The FBI calls on tech companies to "step up" to protect people looking for love online.

description: The outcome of the immunity case before the Supreme Court will have significant ramifications for former President Donald Trump's federal criminal prosecution in Washington, D.C.
title: Supreme Court to weigh Trump immunity claim over 2020 election prosecution

description: Dating companies say protecting their customers is a top priority but critics want them to do more to curb online scams and stop bad actors in their tracks, law enforcement officials and online security experts say. CBS News asks the CEO of Match Group — one of the biggest players in the online dating space — about customers who have lost everything.
title: Dating apps increasingly becoming “hunting grounds” for scammers

description: Summer Lee has defeated Bhavini Patel in the Democratic primary for Pennsylvania's 12th Congressional District, the Associated Press projects.

description: Less than two years after the overturn of Roe v. Wade, the Supreme Court is set to hear a high profile case Wednesday on Idaho’s near-total abortion ban that some doctors say is putting pregnant women at risk.

description: The USDA had floated banning flavored milk options from some school lunches.

description: The hippo took a DNA test and it turns out he's 100% a female.
title: Japan zoo discovers male hippo is actually a female

description: A Texas grand jury indicted more than 140 migrants on misdemeanor rioting charges over an alleged mass attempt to breach the U.S.-Mexico border, a day after a judge threw out the cases.

description: "Although to some, the noise is annoying, they pose no danger to humans or pets," the sheriff wrote. "Unfortunately, it is the sounds of nature."
title: Cicadas are so loud that South Carolina residents are calling police

description: Lawmakers argue the Chinese government can use the widely popular video-sharing app as a spy tool and to covertly influence the U.S. public.

description: The Supreme Court is hearing arguments in a case that pits Idaho's near-total abortion ban against a federal law that the Biden administration says requires hospitals to offer emergency abortion care in certain situations.
title: Supreme Court hears dispute over Idaho abortion ban and federal emergency care

description: Columbia University has given students 48 hours to dismantle their pro-Palestinian encampment on the school's main lawn.
title: Columbia "making important progress" with pro-Palestinian protesters

description: U.S. journalist Evan Gershkovich will remain "wrongfully detained" by Russia - with no sign yet of a trial on espionage charges – until at least June.
title: Russian court extends Evan Gershkovich's pretrial detention yet again

description: A person magnet fishing in Horse Creek found a .22-caliber rifle, a cellphone, driver's licenses and credit cards, authorities said.

description: Expanded federal overtime rule could result in employers paying workers an additional $1.5 billion, according to one estimate.
title: 4.3 million more workers will soon get OT pay. Here's who qualifies.

description: Seventeen-year-old Gukesh Dommaraju of India is the youngest challenger for the world chess title later this year. CBS News' John Dickerson has the details.
title: Indian teen chess prodigy could become world champ

description: Earlier this month, the Arizona Supreme Court ruled that the highly-restrictive 160-year-old law that bans nearly all abortions can be enforced.
title: Arizona Democrats poised to continue effort to repeal 1864 abortion ban

description: John Dickerson reports on tabloid testimony in the criminal trial of former President Donald Trump, what's behind the exodus of teachers, and how romance scam victims can be pulled into the crime themselves.
title: 4/23: The Daily Report with John Dickerson

description: It comes over a year after a shooting at a Nashville school killed three children and three adults.
title: Tennessee legislature passes bill allowing teachers to carry concealed guns

description: CBS News is investigating a growing number of fraud cases known as romance scams. Chief investigative correspondent Jim Axelrod explains how victims can unknowingly become perpetrators in the very scams they fall prey to.
title: How online romance scams turn victims into accomplices

description: The White House is considering declaring a national climate emergency to unlock federal powers and stifle oil development, according to a Bloomberg report. Meanwhile, the Biden administration is announcing several projects this Earth Week. Columbia University Climate School professor Dr. Melissa Lott joins with analysis.
title: White House considering national climate emergency declaration

description: Teachers are in short supply in the U.S., and researchers say there's declining job satisfaction among those who remain. CBS News reporter Bo Erickson examines what's behind the problems.
title: More teachers are quitting, and those who remain aren't happy, researchers say

description: The U.S. is close to delivering a $61 billion aid package to the Ukrainian military, and Russia's defense minister said Tuesday that Moscow would ramp up its own weapons production in response. William Taylor, former U.S. ambassador to Ukraine, joins CBS News to discuss.
title: Russia aims to ramp up strikes on arms storage in Ukraine

description: Ryan Watson could face at least 12 years in prison in Turks and Caicos after airport security allegedly found four rounds of hunting ammo in his carry-on.
title: American tourist facing prison in Turks and Caicos over ammo in luggage

description: The Federal Trade Commission officially banned new noncompete agreements Tuesday, giving workers who are considering quitting more options. The U.S. Chamber of Commerce plans to sue in response.
title: FTC bans noncompete agreements

description: Jim Axelrod dives into the world of romance scams, showing how sometimes the victims can also become unwitting accomplices in the scammers' financial crimes.
title: How romance scam victims become unwitting accomplices

description: Congress is advancing a $95 billion foreign aid package that would provide support to Israel, Ukraine and Taiwan. Senate leaders of both parties encouraged their colleagues on Tuesday to move quickly and get the measure passed. CBS News congressional correspondent Nikole Killion has the details.
title: Schumer, McConnell urge Senate to pass foreign aid package

description: Prosecutors argued Tuesday that former President Donald Trump has repeatedly broken a gag order in his New York criminal trial that forbids him from talking about witnesses and jurors, among others. Trump and his legal team say he's just responding to others' attacks. CBS News campaign reporter and attorney Katrina Kaufman unpacks the day's proceedings.
title: What to know about the gag order in Trump's "hush money" trial

description: The Supreme Court is set to hear oral arguments Wednesday over the clash between Idaho's near-total abortion ban and a federal law that requires Medicare-participating hospitals to provide emergency care to women whose health is at serious risk. Amanda Seitz, health policy reporter for The Associated Press, joins "America Decides" to discuss.
title: Supreme Court to hear Idaho emergency abortions case

description: This will be the first General Conference since more than 7,600 mostly conservative congregations left the United Methodist Church between 2019 and 2023.
title: United Methodists open first high-level conference since LGBTQ disaffiliations
